title: Understanding Harm Reduction
text: Harm reduction is a set of practical strategies aimed at reducing negative consequences associated with drug use. It is a movement for social justice built on a belief in, and respect for, the rights of people who use drugs.

title: Key Components of Harm Reduction
text: Harm reduction strategies include needle exchange programs, supervised consumption services, and providing access to naloxone to prevent overdoses.

hintAnswer: focuses on meeting the client where they are and helping to prevent overdose, reducing transmission of infectious diseases, and improving the overall health of the client
title: Identifying the Correct Approach
text: Which of the following best describes the harm reduction approach?
choices: focuses on meeting the client where they are and helping to prevent overdose, reducing transmission of infectious diseases, and improving the overall health of the client
